title: The NCAA Enters the 21st Century. And the 20th.
text:
This week, the NCAA expressed its willingness to loosen restrictions on college athletes monetizing their name, image and likeness—an overdue move that signals, once more, that when the NCAA shrieks that a reasonable idea is bad for college sports, someone should immediately, loudly, play “Yakety Sax” on a 10-cent kazoo.

After all, you and I are old enough to remember all the way back to this past September, when California began kicking around legislation that would allow college athletes to capitalize on their names/images/likenesses,...
description: The NCAA is finally opening up to name/image/likeness rule changes. Plus, what’s up at Deadspin?
